snippet: Choir singing and vestment-wearing is down, while the use of visual projection equipment and the practice of jumping, shouting or dancing are up.
abstract: The Upshot; new National Congregations Study finds that houses of worship, like the broader culture, are becoming increasingly informal, and increasingly open to gay men and lesbians; more Americans worship in congregations where drums are played, words or images are projected on screens, and praise is expressed via upstretched hands.
lead_paragraph: Choir singing and vestment-wearing is down, while the use of visual projection equipment and the practice of jumping, shouting or dancing are up.
